perturbation.original_text:
Fees: The Fees for the Project shall be $279,000.00 Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer: 20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #2. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.

*Milestone Delivery Schedule for Phase 1

Milestone #1 -January 1st, 2019 Milestone #2- February 1st, 2019. Milestone #3 - March 1st, 2019. Milestone #4 - April 1st, 2019.
perturbation.changed_text:
Fees: The Fees for the Project shall be $279,000.00 Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer: 20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #2. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.

*Milestone Delivery Schedule for Phase 1

Milestone #1 -January 1st, 2019 Milestone #2- February 1st, 2019. Milestone #3 - March 1st, 2019. Milestone #4 - April 1st, 2019. In the event that any milestone is not completed by the dates specified, the client will receive a credit of 5% of the total project fees.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction. Section 4 outlines the payment schedule tied to milestone completion. The added text at the end of the same section states that if a milestone is missed, the client will get a 5% credit of the total project fees. This creates ambiguity: Does the developer still get paid for a milestone if it's late, and the client gets a credit, or is payment contingent upon on-time delivery despite the credit clause? This contradicts the payment schedule laid out and creates an enforcement issue.

perturbation.original_text: 3. Delivery Schedule Based on the current requirements and this SOW, Seattle Software Developers estimates that this project will take around six [4] months of development, testing, and deployment. This estimate may change depending on unforeseen circumstances or requirements. We estimate that the website (Customer Portal) will take 3 months to complete because this will be the priority.
perturbation.changed_text: 3. Delivery Schedule Based on the current requirements and this SOW, Seattle Software Developers guarantees that this project will take around six [4] months of development, testing, and deployment. There will be a penalty of 1% of the total project cost per week for failure to deliver on time. We estimate that the website (Customer Portal) will take 3 months to complete because this will be the priority.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction regarding the project timeline. Initially, Section 3 states an estimate of six months, acknowledging potential changes. This is a projection. The change makes the timeline a guarantee, and it imposes a penalty for delays. However, the existing text that "This estimate may change depending on unforeseen circumstances or requirements" from the original text directly contradicts the guarantee, creating uncertainty about whether the penalty applies if unforeseen circumstances cause delays. The client could try to enforce a penalty, but the developer can invoke the exception clause.

perturbation.original_text: 4. Fee Payment Schedule Fees: The Fees for the Project shall be $279,000.00 Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer: 20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #2. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Fee Payment Schedule Fees: The Fees for the Project shall be $279,000.00 Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer: 20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1, subject to client approval. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #2. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.
perturbation.explanation: This adds a condition to the Milestone #1 payment. While the original schedule dictates payment upon milestone completion, the altered version makes payment for Milestone #1 subject to client approval. This creates ambiguity. Does "completion" automatically trigger payment, or does the client have the right to withhold payment even if the milestone is technically completed? This introduces uncertainty regarding payment terms, creating an enforcement issue.
